Topical.attention_classifier.ClassifierTrainer¶

class Topical.attention_classifier.ClassifierTrainer(model: Optional[Union[transformers.modeling_utils.PreTrainedModel, torch.nn.modules.module.Module]] = None, args: Optional[transformers.training_args.TrainingArguments] = None, data_collator: Optional[DataCollator] = None, train_dataset: Optional[torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset] = None, eval_dataset: Optional[torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset] = None, tokenizer: Optional[transformers.tokenization_utils_base.PreTrainedTokenizerBase] = None, model_init: Optional[Callable[], transformers.modeling_utils.PreTrainedModel]] = None, compute_metrics: Optional[Callable[[transformers.trainer_utils.EvalPrediction], Dict]] = None, callbacks: Optional[List[transformers.trainer_callback.TrainerCallback]] = None, optimizers: Tuple[torch.optim.optimizer.Optimizer, torch.optim.lr_scheduler.LambdaLR] = (None, None))¶

Classification Task Trainer - inheriting from HuggingFace Trainer class (see HG documentation)

ClassifierTrainer.add_callback(callback)

Add a callback to the current list of TrainerCallback.

ClassifierTrainer.call_model_init([trial])

ClassifierTrainer.compute_loss(model, inputs)

How the loss is computed by Trainer.

ClassifierTrainer.create_model_card([…])

ClassifierTrainer.create_optimizer()

Setup the optimizer.

ClassifierTrainer.create_optimizer_and_scheduler(…)

Setup the optimizer and the learning rate scheduler.

ClassifierTrainer.create_scheduler(…)

Setup the scheduler.

ClassifierTrainer.evaluate([eval_dataset, …])

Run evaluation and returns metrics.

ClassifierTrainer.evaluation_loop(…[, …])

Prediction/evaluation loop, shared by Trainer.evaluate() and Trainer.predict().

ClassifierTrainer.floating_point_ops(inputs)

For models that inherit from PreTrainedModel, uses that method to compute the number of floating point operations for every backward + forward pass.

ClassifierTrainer.get_eval_dataloader([…])

Returns the evaluation DataLoader.

ClassifierTrainer.get_test_dataloader(…)

Returns the test DataLoader.

ClassifierTrainer.get_train_dataloader()

Returns the training DataLoader.

ClassifierTrainer.hyperparameter_search([…])

Launch an hyperparameter search using optuna or Ray Tune.

ClassifierTrainer.is_local_process_zero()

Whether or not this process is the local (e.g., on one machine if training in a distributed fashion on several machines) main process.

ClassifierTrainer.is_world_process_zero()

Whether or not this process is the global main process (when training in a distributed fashion on several machines, this is only going to be True for one process).

ClassifierTrainer.log(logs)

Log logs on the various objects watching training.

ClassifierTrainer.log_metrics(split, metrics)

Log metrics in a specially formatted way

ClassifierTrainer.metrics_format(metrics)

Reformat Trainer metrics values to a human-readable format

ClassifierTrainer.num_examples(dataloader)

Helper to get number of samples in a DataLoader by accessing its dataset.

ClassifierTrainer.pop_callback(callback)

Remove a callback from the current list of TrainerCallback and returns it.

ClassifierTrainer.predict(test_dataset[, …])

Run prediction and returns predictions and potential metrics.

ClassifierTrainer.prediction_loop(…[, …])

Prediction/evaluation loop, shared by Trainer.evaluate() and Trainer.predict().

ClassifierTrainer.prediction_step(model, …)

Perform an evaluation step on model using obj:inputs.

ClassifierTrainer.push_to_hub([repo_name, …])

Upload self.model to the 🤗 model hub.

ClassifierTrainer.remove_callback(callback)

Remove a callback from the current list of TrainerCallback.

ClassifierTrainer.save_metrics(split, metrics)

Save metrics into a json file for that split, e.g.

ClassifierTrainer.save_model([output_dir])

Will save the model, so you can reload it using from_pretrained().

ClassifierTrainer.save_state()

Saves the Trainer state, since Trainer.save_model saves only the tokenizer with the model

ClassifierTrainer.store_flos()

ClassifierTrainer.train([…])

Main training entry point.

ClassifierTrainer.training_step(model, inputs)

Perform a training step on a batch of inputs.
